Configure Downlink QoS

Use this task to configure a downlink QoS profile for Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) maps to be applied to data traffic from the HNG to access network devices, such as the RRH.

The following DSCP maps are available for use in this task:
  • af11 - Assured Forwarding-11 (10)
  • af12 - Assured Forwarding-12 (12)
  • af13 - Assured Forwarding-13 (14)
  • af21 - Assured Forwarding-21 (18)
  • af22 - Assured Forwarding-22 (20)
  • af23 - Assured Forwarding-23 (22)
  • af31 - Assured Forwarding-31 (26)
  • af32 - Assured Forwarding-32 (28)
  • af33 - Assured Forwarding-33 (30)
  • af41 - Assured Forwarding-41 (34)
  • af42 - Assured Forwarding-42 (36)
  • af43 - Assured Forwarding-43 (38)
  • best-effort - Best Effort (0)
  • cs1 - Class Selector-1 (8)
  • cs2 - Class Selector-2 (16)
  • cs3 - Class Selector-3 (24)
  • cs4 - Class Selector-4 (32)
  • cs5 - Class Selector-5 (40)
  • cs6 - Class Selector-6 (48)
  • cs7 - Class Selector-7 (56)
  • ef - (Default) Expedited Forwarding (46)
  1. In the navigation bar, click Profiles > Summary.
  2. In the Profiles window, click the System Profiles tab.
  3. Click +Create.
  4. In the Create System Profile window, enter the name of this profile in the Profile Name field.
  5. Select DownlinkQos from the Profile Type drop-down list and complete the following fields:

    Field

    Description
    Control DSCP drop-down list

    Select the DSCP map value (see above) for control data traffic on a network. The default is cs6.
    Signaling DSCP drop-down list

    Select the DSCP map value (see above) for signalling data traffic on a network. The default is ef.
    Local Data DSCP Select the DSCP map value (see above) for signalling data traffic on a local (core) network. The default is af42.
    GSM MF Signaling DSCP

    Select the DSCP map value (see above) for QoS profile for Global System for Mobile Communications (GSM) Multi-frequency signaling (MF) packet-oriented mobile data traffic. The default is ef.
    GSM Voice Override The parameter is Disabled by default. Select Enabled to associate QoS DSCP profile values for backhaul network Global System for Mobile Communications (GSM) voice traffic.
    GSM Voice DSCP

    Select the DSCP map value (see above) for QoS profile for Global System for Mobile Communications (GSM) cell voice traffic. The default is ef.
    GPRS Data Override The parameter is Disabled by default. Select Enabled to associate QoS DSCP profile values for General Packet Radio Service (GPRS) packet-oriented mobile data traffic.
    GPRS Data DSCP

    Select the DSCP map value (see above) for QoS profile for GPRS packet-oriented mobile data traffic. The default is af31.
    Edge Data Override The parameter is Disabled by default. Select Enabled to associate QoS profile DSCP values for backhaul network Enhanced Data rates for Global System for Mobile Communications (GSM) Evolution (EDGE) cell traffic.
    Edge DSCP

    Select the DSCP map value (see above) for bandwidth settings for backhaul network EDGE cell data traffic on a network. The default is af31.
    UMTS Voice Override drop-down list This parameter is Disabled by default. Select Enabled to associate with bandwidth settings for DSCP profiles for backhaul network UMTS voice traffic.
    UMTS Voice DSCP

    Select the DSCP map value (see above) for QoS profile UMTS voice traffic on a network. The default is ef.
    UMTS Data Override drop-down list This parameter is Disabled by default. Select Enable to associate bandwidth settings for the QoS DSCP profile for backhaul network UMTS data traffic.
    UMTS Data DSCP drop-down list

    Select the DSCP map value (see above) for bandwidth settings associated with the QoS profile for backhaul network UMTS data traffic. The default is af42.
    LTE Override The parameter is Disabled by default. Select Enabled to associate QoS DSCP profile values for LTE traffic.
    LTE Data DSCP

    Select the DSCP map value (see above) for QoS profile for LTE traffic. The default is af42.
  6. Click Create+.
Parent topic: Create Network Profiles
